title: Can not start new node with `./bin/op-node` command

labels.name: C-customer-issue
labels.description: Category: An issue encountered by customers integrating with Optimism

body: **Describe the bug** I'm following the [offical docs](https://stack.optimism.io/docs/build/getting-started/#reinitializing-op-geth). but I'm stucking at [this step](https://stack.optimism.io/docs/build/getting-started/#run-op-node) **To Reproduce** I used command following: ```bash ./bin/op-node \  ✔  ⬢ 16.19.1   1.20.2  16:07:49  --l2=http://localhost:8551 \ --l2.jwt-secret=./jwt.txt \ --sequencer.enabled \ --sequencer.l1-confs=3 \ --verifier.l1-confs=3 \ --rollup.config=./rollup.json \ --rpc.addr=0.0.0.0 \ --rpc.port=8547 \ --p2p.listen.ip=0.0.0.0 \ --p2p.listen.tcp=9003 \ --p2p.listen.udp=9003 \ --rpc.enable-admin \ --p2p.sequencer.key="my_sequencer_key" \ --l1="https://endpoints.omniatech.io/v1/eth/goerli/public" \ --l1.rpckind="alchemy" ``` Then I get the following errors: ```bash ERROR[03-09|16:07:56.953] failed to fetch runtime config data err="failed to fetch unsafe block signing address from system config: failed to verify retrieved proof against state root: value 0 in storage proof does not match proven value at key 0x65a7ed542fb37fe237fdfbdd70b31598523fe5b32879e307bae27a0bd9581c08 (path 31a88f3936348d602f3078126bdcd162c575cb17fb9bbfe2dab00b167bd295c3)" ``` **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. **System Specs:** - OS: MacOS 13.2.1 - Chip M1 **Additional Context** I found `0x65a7ed542fb37fe237fdfbdd70b31598523fe5b32879e307bae27a0bd9581c08` and `31a88f3936348d602f3078126bdcd162c575cb17fb9bbfe2dab00b167bd295c3` from the ERROR above are hardcoded in the source code, so am I making a mistake at some step?
Does this work if you use a different RPC provider?

> Does this work if you use a different RPC provider?

> --l1.rpckind="alchemy", can you change this to "any"?

I have tried both ways but still get the same error.
The system config contract that it is configured to interact with is probably wrong

I am also getting almost the same issue,

Command:
--------------

```
./bin/op-node \
	--l2=http://localhost:8551 \
	--l2.jwt-secret=./jwt.txt \
	--sequencer.enabled \
	--sequencer.l1-confs=3 \
	--verifier.l1-confs=3 \
	--rollup.config=./rollup.json \
	--rpc.addr=0.0.0.0 \
	--rpc.port=8547 \
	--p2p.disable \
	--rpc.enable-admin \
	--p2p.sequencer.key="my_sequencer_key" \
	--l1=https://eth-goerli.g.alchemy.com/v2/nEHMQdz1vKR74IwikCQWgCCwSDZ-JSZZ \
	--l1.rpckind=alchemy
```

Error Log as output:
--------------------------

```
INFO [04-10|12:55:12.366] Initializing Rollup Node 
INFO [04-10|12:55:12.367] rollup config:
L2 Chain ID: 42069 (unknown L2)
L1 Chain ID: 5 (goerli)
Bedrock starting point:
  L2 starting time: 1681101792 ~ Mon Apr 10 10:43:12 +06 2023
  L2 block: 0x9c9fe57c2f6358126870415a1574fd39be21744e07dd73770ce170154689e171 0
  L1 block: 0xf21262f64ffe78e7d89e076733cd922db1c839e1525ac25a12ed5e68c7d753a5 8804529
Post-Bedrock Network Upgrades (timestamp based):
  - Regolith: (not configured)
 
ERROR[04-10|12:55:14.385] Error initializing the rollup node       err="failed to fetch header by num 8804529: failed to verify block hash: computed 0xfa1bdc21d200482ac826569e90a25f87d85b34400e98c4522ccbe157a90c73a4 but RPC said 0xf21262f64ffe78e7d89e076733cd922db1c839e1525ac25a12ed5e68c7d753a5"
ERROR[04-10|12:55:14.386] Unable to create the rollup node         error="failed to fetch header by num 8804529: failed to verify block hash: computed 0xfa1bdc21d200482ac826569e90a25f87d85b34400e98c4522ccbe157a90c73a4 but RPC said 0xf21262f64ffe78e7d89e076733cd922db1c839e1525ac25a12ed5e68c7d753a5"
CRIT [04-10|12:55:14.386] Application failed                       message="failed to fetch header by num 8804529: failed to verify block hash: computed 0xfa1bdc21d200482ac826569e90a25f87d85b34400e98c4522ccbe157a90c73a4 but RPC said 0xf21262f64ffe78e7d89e076733cd922db1c839e1525ac25a12ed5e68c7d753a5"
```
any updates on this issue since i am getting same error as original poster. I am running on am Ubuntu VM

@protolambda + @smartcontracts  any idea?

This issue is happening to a lot of people and since March 9 without being publicly sorted out yet.

The header-fetch error happens when running old op-node software that didn't support the L1 ethereum Shanghai/Capella upgrade yet, and thus fails to verify the blocks past that upgrade (upgrade was March 14 for Goerli L1).

The signing-address fetch error (with the "failed to verify retrieved proof") is unrelated, and happens when the L1 RPC does not fully support `eth_getProof` (common, happens with Erigon and node providers that use Erigon), or if the `SystemConfig` is not present on the L1 (if you are trying to run an alt op-chain this may be the case).
A work-around is to use the `--l1.trustrpc` flag, to fallback to direct retrieval of the system configuration data, and not verify with a proof. If you trust the RPC you use for L1, that's a valid way to load system configuration. If you do not trust the L1 RPC, and they do not provide support for `eth_getProof`, you should switch to a different RPC provider.

@protolambda in my case my L1 is Polygon.
Do that have implications?

@danimesq and where/how is the L2 deployed? Is it a custom L2? Optimism Bedrock does not officially support Polygon as L1. You may have to change the block-header and/or state-proof verification to be compatible with Polygon.

@protolambda I'm getting the same error as reported by OP (no pun intended) in the issue.

The contracts are successfully deployed to Polygon (although I went into that timeout issue and had to do manual txs using MetaMask rather than "cast"), as expected for an EVM-native chain.
Deployer/Admin: https://polygonscan.com/address/0x53d44EbC95990fF2bDd2Fd427C4E9AEE8e76CB0c

So, L1's network ID is 137 and L2's ID is 133.

I don't know if I can call it a "custom L2" as I didn't change - beyond the necessary customizations guided by the [OP Stack Docs](https://stack.optimism.io/docs/build/getting-started/) - the codebase , available [here](https://github.com/POL3Chain/op-geth/tree/optimism-polygon) and [here](https://github.com/POL3Chain/optimism/tree/polygon).

op-geth command I use:

```bash
./build/bin/geth \
	--datadir ./datadir \
	--http \
	--http.corsdomain="*" \
	--http.vhosts="*" \
	--http.addr=0.0.0.0 \
	--http.api=web3,debug,eth,txpool,net,engine \
	--ws \
	--ws.addr=0.0.0.0 \
	--ws.port=8546 \
	--ws.origins="*" \
	--ws.api=debug,eth,txpool,net,engine \
	--syncmode=full \
	--gcmode=archive \
	--nodiscover \
	--maxpeers=0 \
	--networkid=133 \
	--authrpc.vhosts="*" \
	--authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0 \
	--authrpc.port=8551 \
	--authrpc.jwtsecret=./jwt.txt \
	--rollup.disabletxpoolgossip=true \
	--password=./datadir/password \
	--allow-insecure-unlock \
	--mine \
	--miner.etherbase=$SEQ_ADDR \
	--unlock=$SEQ_ADDR
```

----

op-node:

```bash
./bin/op-node \
	--l2=http://localhost:8551 \
	--l2.jwt-secret=./jwt.txt \
	--sequencer.enabled \
	--sequencer.l1-confs=3 \
	--verifier.l1-confs=3 \
	--rollup.config=./rollup.json \
	--rpc.addr=0.0.0.0 \
	--rpc.port=8547 \
	--p2p.disable \
	--rpc.enable-admin \
	--p2p.sequencer.key=$SEQ_KEY \
	--l1=$L1_RPC \
	--l1.rpckind=$RPC_KIND
```

Output:

```bash
t=2023-05-16T15:08:38-0300 lvl=info msg="Initializing Rollup Node"
INFO [05-16|15:08:38.395] Rollup Config                            l2_chain_id=133 l2_network="unknown L2" l1_chain_id=137 l1_network="unknown L1" l2_start_time=1,684,028,765 l2_block_hash=0x411e1527a8bbdf7f43b50710664a954be6b853f94dbcf9ccf6455fb56cc39e2c l2_block_number=0 l1_block_hash=0x3e634150b4ee21e7d4a532b6231ec5ad89021c7df248ba35a9aa6ed6f62a7974 l1_block_number=42,676,207 regolith_time="@ genesis"
```

Config files are available [here](https://github.com/POL3Chain/op-geth/tree/optimism-polygon) and [here](https://github.com/POL3Chain/optimism/tree/polygon), as previously noted.

Output after using the `--l1.trustrpc` flag is different, more clean which means there's minus 1 error:

```bash
t=2023-05-16T15:08:21-0300 lvl=info msg="Initializing Rollup Node"
INFO [05-16|15:08:21.069] Rollup Config                            l2_chain_id=133 l2_network="unknown L2" l1_chain_id=137 l1_network="unknown L1" l2_start_time=1,684,028,765 l2_block_hash=0x411e1527a8bbdf7f43b50710664a954be6b853f94dbcf9ccf6455fb56cc39e2c l2_block_number=0 l1_block_hash=0x3e634150b4ee21e7d4a532b6231ec5ad89021c7df248ba35a9aa6ed6f62a7974 l1_block_number=42,676,207 regolith_time="@ genesis"
ERROR[05-16|15:08:22.396] failed to fetch runtime config data      err="failed to fetch unsafe block signing address from system config: json-rpc error -32005"
ERROR[05-16|15:08:23.216] failed to fetch runtime config data      err="failed to fetch unsafe block signing address from system config: json-rpc error -32005"
ERROR[05-16|15:08:23.830] failed to fetch runtime config data      err="failed to fetch unsafe block signing address from system config: json-rpc error -32005"
ERROR[05-16|15:08:24.444] failed to fetch runtime config data      err="failed to fetch unsafe block signing address from system config: json-rpc error -32005"
ERROR[05-16|15:08:25.058] failed to fetch runtime config data      err="failed to fetch unsafe block signing address from system config: json-rpc error -32005"
ERROR[05-16|15:08:25.058] Error initializing the rollup node       err="failed to load runtime configuration repeatedly"
ERROR[05-16|15:08:25.058] Unable to create the rollup node         error="failed to load runtime configuration repeatedly"
CRIT [05-16|15:08:25.058] Application failed                       message="failed to load runtime configuration repeatedly"
```

I believe the program could display a more helpful message, no?

Searching on Google, now I understand the error -32005 occurs when the RPC reaches its rate limit: https://blog.logrocket.com/understanding-resolving-metamask-error-codes/#32005

So, in 2 different ways, the issue is in the RPC side.

Ok, I have used an Alchemy RPC and now finally it advanced.

But now I get these:

```bash
INFO [05-17|14:07:26.745] Advancing bq origin                      origin=e500ad..fe6ed7:42676222 originBehind=false
WARN [05-17|14:07:27.380] L1 head signal indicates a possible L1 re-org old_l1_head=acecf7..b3f15b:42822172 new_l1_head_parent=17de4e..ece768 new_l1_head=f95b78..8efff1:42822177
```

```bash
WARN [05-17|14:08:04.863] Derivation process temporary error       attempts=1 err="temp: failed to fetch receipts of L1 block 0x438a4a6c65858be6d1718049c81372a4c557d19fdbbaf191e24d2f87c796bd92:42676271 for L1 sysCfg update: receipt 64 has invalid gas used metadata: 0, expected 18446744073680135202"
INFO [05-17|14:08:05.252] creating new block                       parent=be614b..eff805:69 l1Origin=880709..3f0bae:42676272
ERROR[05-17|14:08:05.681] sequencer temporarily failed to start building new block err="temp: failed to fetch L1 block info and receipts: receipt 64 has invalid gas used metadata: 0, expected 18446744073680135202"
```

@protolambda + @smartcontracts is that because I'm using Polygon as L1 or I should use an more up-to-date L1 starting block?

Or, also, `L1 sysCfg update: receipt 64 has invalid gas used metadata: 0, expected 18446744073680135202` may mean my Alchemy endpoint/RPC ran out of data limit?

No guarantee that we support polygon as an L1. Please use the latest releases. The `make devnet-up` command works, will build the images locally. If you are having this issue still with ethereum as the L1, please reopen
